solution_line_template: The chest of drawers sold for half as much as the treadmill, for a price of ${treadmill_price}/{half_divisor}= $<<{treadmill_price}/{half_divisor}={chest_of_drawers_price}>>{chest_of_drawers_price}.

The television sold for three times what he earned for the treadmill, for a price of ${treadmill_price}*{three_times_multiplier}= $<<{treadmill_price}*{three_times_multiplier}={television_price}>>{television_price}.

For the three items, he raised ${treadmill_price}+${chest_of_drawers_price}+${television_price} = $<<{treadmill_price}+{chest_of_drawers_price}+{television_price}={three_items_total}>>{three_items_total}.

If ${three_items_total} is {percentage_of_total} of the total sum of money that Toby made at the garage sale, then the total amount is ${three_items_total} / ({percentage_of_total}) = ${total_sales_money}.
